All commonly used values according to Taginfo
A bowling game played in Europe with only 9 pins.
A bowling game popular in North America with 10 pins.
A sport played by two teams of eleven players on a rectangular field with goalposts at each end.
A Japanese martial art by blending with the motion of the attacker and redirecting the force of the attack rather than opposing it head-on.
The art, practice, or skill of propelling arrows with the use of a bow.
A collection of sports which combines various athletic contests based on the skills of running, jumping, and throwing.

A sport played between two teams of eighteen players on the field of either an Australian football ground, a modified cricket field, or a similarly sized sports venue, also called football, footy, Aussie rules, or AFL.
A racquet sport played by singles or in teams of two, who take positions on opposite halves of a rectangular court (pitch) divided by a net.
Bandy is a sport played by two teams of eleven players on a rectangular field.
BASE jumping is an activity that employs an initially packed parachute to jump from fixed objects.
A bat-and-ball game played between two teams of nine players on a field (pitch or stadium) each who take turns batting and fielding.
A sport played by two teams of five players on a rectangular court.
Volleyball played on a sand court
Cue sports, a wide variety of games of skill generally played with a cue stick which is used to strike billiard balls, moving them around a cloth-covered billiards table bounded by rubber cushions.
A cycle sport performed on BMX bikes, either in competitive BMX racing or freestyle BMX, or else in general on- or off-road recreation.
A winter sport in which teams of two or four make timed runs down narrow, twisting, banked, iced tracks in a gravity-powered sled, also called luge or bobslede.
A group of games in which the objective is to throw or roll heavy balls as close as possible to a small target ball, also called pétanque, lyonnaise, bocce, or bocce volo.
A place where you can play lawn bowls/lawn bowling.

Boxing (pugilism, prize fighting, the sweet science or in Greek pygmachia) is a combat sport in which two people engage in a contest of strength, speed, reflexes, endurance, and will, by throwing punches with gloved hands against each other.
Canadian football (CFL) is a form of gridiron football played in Canada in which two teams of 12 players each compete for territorial control of a field
Canoe and Kayak.
Chess is a popular two-player strategy board game.
Non-competitive diving is jumping from a cliff or a rock into water.
Marks elements to represent natural climbing sites (climbing areas, sectors, crags, halls, frozen waterfalls, etc.) or artificial climbs (climbing walls, indoor climbing etc.)
Used to tag an area as "Adventure Park", "Ropes Courses", "Climbing Adventure", "Zip-line", or "Treetop Adventure", where people climb, walk or otherwise move on prebuilt wires and other objects.
A blood sport between two roosters (cocks), or more accurately gamecocks, held in a ring called a cockpit.
A bat-and-ball sport contested by two teams, usually of eleven players, each on a large grass Cricket pitch. Played on a large circular or oval-shaped grassy Cricket field ground.

A sport or game that is played between two or more players embedded on a small grass playing court or pitch which involves hitting plastic or wooden balls with a mallet through hoops (often called "wickets" in the United States).
A sport in which players slide stones on a sheet of ice towards a target area which is segmented into four concentric rings.
The use of bicycles for sport, also called bicycling, mountain biking or biking.
Darts is a form of throwing game in which small missiles are thrown at a circular target (dartboard) fixed to a wall.
A feature used for dog racing
A sport practised with the horse as a partner
Fencing is the martial art of fighting with blades. Divided into three weapon categories: foil, sabre (spelled saber in the United States) and épée.
Field Hockey
Provides a way to tag landing and takeoff for free flying aircraft with additional related amenities.
Futsal is a sport played by two teams of five players on a rectangular court.
Gaelic Games as played within the GAA[http://www.gaa.ie/about-the-gaa/our-games/] in Ireland, including Gaelic Football, Hurling, Ladies Gaelic Football, Camogie, Handball and Rounders
Golf
Gymnastics
Handball
A dynamic and highly eclectic Korean martial art
Horseshoes
Horse racing
Ice hockey ring.
A sport or pastime by moving on ice while using ice skates.
Ice stock sport, also known as Bavarian curling, is a winter sport, somewhat similar to curling. In German, it is known as Eisstockschießen.
Judo (柔道 jūdō, meaning "gentle way") is a modern martial art, combat and Olympic sport created in Japan in 1882 by Jigoro Kano (嘉納治五郎).
Karate
Kart racing
To mark a spot for kitesurfing
Korfball
A team sport played with a lacrosse stick and a lacrosse ball. Players use the head of the lacrosse stick to carry pass, catch, and shoot the ball into the goal.
Model aerodrome
Motorcycle racing on unpaved surfaces.
Motorsport
A sports facility that is suitable for more than one sport
A hand ball competition between two teams on a rectangular court.
A series of challenging physical obstacles an individual or team must navigate usually while being timed.
Orienteering
Paddle tennis is a racquet sport adapted from tennis and played for over a century.
Padel is a racquet sport invented in 1969 in Acapulco, Mexico.
Parachuting / Skydiving
Radio controlled cars
The traveling on surfaces with roller skates.
Sites connected to the sport of rowing
Features dedicated to the sport of running
Sailing
To mark a spot for scuba diving
Identifies given object as used for practicing shooting sports
An area designated and equipped for skateboarding
Association football, more commonly known as football or soccer
A traditional martial arts sport of Japan.
A spot for surfing.
A place where people do swimming
A bat and ball game played over a table.
Table Soccer or Table Football, also known as Foosball, Fussball, Kicker, or Tecball, is a table-top game and sport based off association football (soccer).
Taekwondo
A competition where two or four players use a ball and rackets over a net.
Public toboggan run
Volleyball
Water polo
Water skiing
Weightlifting
Wrestling
Yoga as exercise
A place to connect landlines subscribers to telecommunication service equipments

Places allowing telecom networks operators to manage wiring resources according to subscribers needs and network availability. Such management reduces the amount of cables needed to reach telephone exchanges.

Active equipment which deliver service to connected customers. It can be for instance a DSLAM, a telephone switch, or more recently an OLT for optical networks. It excludes amplifiers or repeaters installed along local loops or long distance lines.
A building used to house computers and network equipment.
A remote building located in the mountains intended to provide board and lodging.
A furnished apartment or flat with cooking and bathroom facilities that can be rented for holiday vacations.
A facility with living aquatic animals for public viewing.
A public piece of art.
Object of interest for a tourist.
An tent or caravan pitch coordinate within a campsite or caravan site
An area where people can camp overnight using tents, camper vans or caravans.
A place where you can stay in a caravan overnight or for longer periods.
A holiday cottage with self-contained cooking and bathroom facilities.
An area or building that displays a variety of visual art exhibitions.
Accommodation without hotel license that is typically owner-operated, such as bed&breakfasts etc.
Cheap accommodation with shared bedrooms.
Hotel - an establishment that provides paid lodging
Information for tourists and visitors, including information offices
Short term accommodation, particularly for people travelling by car.
A museum: an institution with exhibitions on scientific, historical, cultural topics
A locality that is suitable for outdoors eating, with facilities to aid a picnic such as tables and benches
An amusement park where entertainment is provided by rides, games, concessions. For example, theme parks, discovery parks, open-air museums, miniature parks.
A place worth visiting, often high, with a good view of surrounding countryside or notable buildings.
A remote building, with generally a fireplace, intended to provide temporary shelter and sleeping accommodation, typically un-serviced and with no staff.
A zoological garden, where animals are confined.
The linear flow of a river, in flow direction.
A wide river as defined by its area.
A naturally-forming waterway that is too narrow to be classed as a river.
An artificial '''open flow''' waterway used to carry useful water for transportation, waterpower, or irrigation.
An artificial free flow waterway used for carrying superfluous water, usually lined with concrete.
A small man-made drainage waterway, usually unlined.
An artificial tunnel or pipeline where water flows in a closed space without air
A navigable route in a lake or sea, marked by buoys or beacons.
An enclosed area of water for ships and other craft within which the height of the water can be managed.
A place for constructing, repairing and storing vessels out of the water.
A wall built across a river or stream to block and regulate the flow of the river
A barrier built across a river, sometimes to divert water for industrial purposes. Water can still flow over the top.
A place where water flows over a vertical drop or a series of drops in the course of a stream or river.
A gate of a lock
A place to turn the driving direction for vessels, where the boats are longer than the river/canal is wide.
A place to fill fresh water holding tanks of a boat.
A place to get fuel for boats
